intro: Coccoloba longipes, commonly known as the longipes beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are often heart-shaped and can be quite large, contributing to its ornamental value. Coccoloba longipes is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in gardens and landscapes.
